channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Chinese state media hails Trump's cuts to Voice of America
item.description: State newspaper gloated that the network has "now been discarded by its own government like a dirty rag".

item.title: Angst pervades a pair of Republican town halls — one in Trump country, the other in a swing state
This is why Canada has plenty of eggs — and the U.S. doesn't
item.description: While the U.S. grapples with an egg shortage caused by avian flu, eggs remain plentiful and affordable in Canada. There are reasons for that, includin...

item.title: Israel launches deadly new strikes in Gaza as ceasefire falls apart
item.description: Officials in Hamas-ruled Gaza say the new Israeli assault has killed more than 400 people, as Israel accuses Hamas of refusing to extend the ceasefire...

item.title: In the Missouri Ozarks, residents struggle to rebuild after tornadoes
item.description: Twisters that tore through Union County, Missouri killed 6 people. One couple survived against incomprehensible odds in a trailer obliterated by the s...

item.title: The history of the Alien Enemies Act of 1798
item.description: A federal judge heard arguments Monday on whether the White House violated a court order by deporting migrants without proper court hearings. The Trum...

item.title: Moment Nasa astronauts begin journey back to Earth
item.description: Two astronauts are returning home after nine months in space.

item.title: The Matrix film producer files for bankruptcy
item.description: Village Roadshow blames its troubles on a fall-out with Warner Bros and a failed move into independent film production.

item.title: INTERSPORT – a global organisation with a hyperlocal approach
item.description: Since its inception, the INTERSPORT Group has been defined by a spirit of collaboration and a desire to help people find their place in sport, no matt...

item.title: Oklahomans survey devastation after hundreds of homes are destroyed and damaged by wildfires
U.S. support for free speech drops by 3%, survey finds
item.description: A new survey released Monday by the nonpartisan think tank Future of Free Speech found a 3% drop in support for free speech in the U.S., which puts Am...

item.title: Scientists at Antarctic base rocked by alleged assault
item.description: A spokesperson for the South African government told the BBC there had been an assault at the station.

item.title: At 83, Martha Stewart celebrates gardening with her 101st book
item.description: Martha Stewart talks gardening, wanting to be "one of the girls" and her 101st book with NPR Morning Edition host Michel Martin.

item.title: Trump says he's ending Secret Service protection for Biden's adult children
item.description: President Trump said he was ending "immediately" the Secret Service protection details assigned to Democrat Joe Biden's adult children.

item.title: Remains of another serial killer victim found at landfill, officials say
item.description: Marcedes Myran was one of the Indigenous women slain by convicted serial killer Jeremy Skibicki, authorities say.

item.title: Israel launches 'extensive strikes' on Gaza with at least 330 reportedly killed
item.description: The Israeli military says it is targeting "terror targets" belonging to Hamas.

item.title: 'Segregated facilities' are no longer explicitly banned in federal contracts
item.description: The Trump administration cut a clause from federal contracting rules that had been on the books since the 1960s: Companies are no longer explicitly pr...

item.title: Severe weather moves east after tornadoes, winds and wildfires killed at least 39 people
item.description: Foreboding predictions of dangerous weekend weather came true as a dynamic storm spawned tornadoes, dust storms and wildfires that killed more than th...
